"if you buy after the 27th but before the 10th you WILL still get the 2 for 1 split" Actually, you could buy ON the 10th and get the split shares (assuming you held until the 13th). The ex-date isn't until the 13th.
"if you buy 1000 on 7/28 they will only cost 39 dollars." No. The split doesn't become effective until August 13th. Nobody's shares split until the 13th no matter when they were bought.

"IMHO, this means if you buy the stock AFTER July 27, you will NOT receive the 2-for-1 split." That may be your opinion but it's not reality. KO's website tell you how it's going to work (if you can decipher the complicated language). They specifically say, "seller [after July 27 and before August 13th] is not entitled to the split shares they will receive by virtue of their being holders on the record date." So, if a shareholder of record doesn't get the split shares they will receive (by virtue of being a shareholder of record) if they sell before the ex-date of August 13th, what happens to those shares they have received but aren't entitled to? KO's website explains that too: "Therefore, the split shares are transferred to the buyers [those who bought KO from July 27th through August 10th] by means of "due bills"." Look up due bills and read up on how they work. The process is not of KO's making; they are simply following the same stock exchange rules that every other company has to. http://www.google.com/search?q=due+bills+deferred+ex-date&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-US:official&client=firefox-a
